intro: Psychotria schnellii, commonly known as the "Belize Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central America, particularly Belize and southern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in tropical rainforests. Psychotria schnellii is also notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though research on its properties remains limited.
